rComments: Love was articulate and well prept. He has continued to be helpfull and informative even a year after I finished his class. One of the best philosophy teachers I have had at ucsc

Dear God, I did not like the readings, very confusing and everything was complicated, not fully explained, HE ONLY USES PWRpoint for lectures! Reading is a pain to comprehend sometimes and sections help minimally.

All his lectures were powerpoint, he basically just read the powerpoint, and went very quickly. He didn't make himself avalible to students, wanted everything turned in online, it seemed he had very little intrest in individual students.

OMG the Professor from Hell! He treats this class like it's an upper-division course when it's only an INTRO! He's a really smart guy, but a terrible teacher! He needs to have more courtesy for those students who don't have a philosphical background, because of this I learned nothing! Please if you want to satisfy a T course dont take this class.
